transcripts.text: So you know you're in trouble if you're a Republican president and you start to lose Fox News.

I just wanna say, President Trump has called for Jennifer Griffin to be fired.  This is one of the fairest, most conscientious reporters on the planet, a former war correspondent, has done this throughout various administrations.  And she wasn't offering opinion, she was doing her job.  Now it's fine for the president to attack the story, but he really needs to stop trying to cancel journalists based on reporting he doesn't like.

Now, Donald Trump has no problem labeling even Fox News as fake news, but we see he does that to any media outlet that gives negative reporting on him, regardless of the outlet.  So we can easily infer that for the president of the United States, the only real news is news that is flattering to him.  To know how much credit they should give to this.

Also, a fair observation.  Now, Jeffrey Goldberg has done many defense stories over the years.  Fox's Jennifer Griffin has confirmed key elements of the story based on her sources, as has The Washington Post.  But, Leslie, this isn't just a routine White House denial.  You have several top aides who were there in France, including Sarah Huckabee Sanders, saying on the record this didn't happen.  John Bolton, who trashes Trump in his book, saying he never heard it.

I think maybe they weren't standing with them when he said it.  Look, there are two things here.  Jennifer Griffin is an outstanding journalist.  And to me, you've got to look at not only if there's an anonymous source, but who is reporting that source.  Jennifer Griffin of our own network has confirmed this, corroborated this.  Washington Post, New York Times.  But in addition, how we have to look at a pattern of behavior.  And the president, I mean, with the mocking of the disabled journalists, the president, you know, saying negative things about a Gold Star family, a grieving mother, saying to a mother of a fallen soldier in Niger, you know, that he knew what he signed up for, the things that he said about John McCain, and also his level of defense about it.  YOU KNOW, MY MOM USED TO SAY IF YOU ACCUSE SOMEBODY OF SOMETHING AND THEY DEFEND THEMSELVES AGAIN AND AGAIN AND AGAIN, THEY'RE PROBABLY GUILTY BECAUSE IF YOU'RE NOT, IT DOESN'T BOTHER YOU.  SO TO ME THE PATTERN OF BEHAVIOR SPEAKS TO THE JOURNALIST'S CLAIMS.

I just want to say, President Trump has called for Jennifer Griffin to be fired.  This is one of the fairest, most conscientious reporters on the planet.  A former war correspondent has done this throughout various administrations.  And she wasn't offering opinion.  She was doing her job.  Now, it's fine for the president to attack the story, but he really needs to stop trying to cancel journalists based on reporting he doesn't like.  And on that point, Molly... Here's what Jen Griffin told Neil Cavuto yesterday.  She said, Deep Throat was an unnamed source.  Doesn't make what he said untrue.  My sources are unimpeachable.  Why haven't they come forward?  She says, you can see how people get destroyed when they get crosswise with the president.

Again, this speaks to the pattern of behavior.  This is not, you know, quite frankly, it's very sad, but these remarks aren't shocking coming from the president.  And when you also speak of a pattern of behavior, the president has a pattern of behavior of not telling the truth.  So at the end of the day, the I as a voter sit down and say, and I think other voters look at the pattern of behavior of this individual with regard to truthfulness and with regard to these types of comments about these individuals.  Look, there are people that probably believe what he said and will vote for him anyway, Howie, especially in the military.  The military are typically very pro-Republican, and the president is the incumbent Republican candidate.  But I do think, and I've heard from on my radio show, some vets that weren't shocked, but it was just sort of rubbing salt in an old wound that reminded them with the election coming up of who their commander-in-chief is.  All right.

Let me tell you all, we're getting a little short on time.  By the way, the president this morning, continuing his assault, calling Jeffrey Goldberg a con man and saying that people should write to the Atlantic's majority, or to Lorraine Powell Jobs, Steve Jobs' widow, to express their...

Donald Trump is in trouble this election, and the only way that he can actually win is if he sabotages the election.  If he's losing Fox News, we've seen polling that his attack on protesters with the entire law and order mandate, that's not working.  That's not cutting through.  In fact, it's backfiring.  And so he's losing conservatives.  He's losing Fox News.  He's losing the military and he's losing losing the messaging campaign, which is why he's attacking conservatives.  He is going on attack with attacking mail-in ballots.  He's attacking the validity of the election already.  He's doing everything he can possibly to stay in power.  And so we can expect that the president will turn on everyone and do anything he possibly can to maintain power.  As it pertains to this particular story, I don't think anyone who's watching this clip is surprised.  This is not outside of Donald Trump's normal pattern of behavior.  This is how he is.  This is who he is.  This is what he is.  He has no respect for anyone except for himself.  And he's only concerned with his ego.  He's a narcissistic, mangler, maniac and a sociopath.  And he must be voted out of office.
